text: Psalm 105
Praise to Yahweh for His Work on Behalf of Israel
Give thanks to Yahweh; proclaim his name;
make known his deeds among the peoples.
Sing to him; sing praises concerning him;
tell of all his wonderful works.
Boast about his holy name.
Let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
Make supplication to Yahweh and his might;
seek his face continually.
Remember his wonders that he has done,
his signs and the judgments of his mouth,
O offspring of Abraham his servant,
\add you\add* descendants\f + \fr 105:6 \ft Or “children,” or “sons” \f* of Jacob, his chosen ones.
He \add is\add* Yahweh our God;
his judgments \add are\add* in all the earth.
He remembers his covenant forever,
\add the\add* word \add that\add* he commanded
for a thousand generations,
that he made with Abraham,
and by his oath \add swore\add* to Isaac.
He then confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
to Israel \add as\add* an everlasting covenant,
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
\add as\add* the allotment \add that is\add* your\f + \fr 105:11 \ft Hebrew plural \f* inheritance.”
When they were ⸤few in number⸥\f + \fr 105:12 \ft Literally “men of number,” that is, so few you could count them \f*—
a trifle—and \add were\add* sojourners in it,
and they wandered about ⸤among the nations⸥,\f + \fr 105:13 \ft Literally “from people to people” \f*
from \add one\add* kingdom to another people,
he allowed no one to oppress them,
and he rebuked kings on account of them,
“Do not touch my anointed ones,
nor harm my prophets.”
Then he called for a famine upon the land;
he broke every ⸤supply⸥\f + \fr 105:16 \ft Literally “staff” \f* of bread.
He sent a man on ahead of them;
Joseph was sold as a slave.
They clamped\f + \fr 105:18 \ft Hebrew “oppressed, hurt” \f* his feet in fetters.\f + \fr 105:18 \ft Hebrew “fetter” \f*
His neck\f + \fr 105:18 \ft Hebrew \fqa nephesh \ft can designate the life, soul, appetite, desire, or throat/neck. \f* went into irons.\f + \fr 105:18 \ft Hebrew “iron” \f*
Until \add the\add* time his word came about,
the word of Yahweh tested\f + \fr 105:19 \ft Or “refined” \f* him.
\add The\add* king sent and he freed him;
\add the\add* ruler of \add the\add* peoples \add sent\add* and let him loose.
He made him lord of his house
and ruler of all his possessions,

to obligate\f + \fr 105:22 \ft Hebrew “to bind, imprison” The LXX’s “to instruct” presupposes \fqa ysr \ft instead of \fqa 'sr \ft , and might be correct in light of the parallelism that is fairly tight in this psalm \f* his officials ⸤as he saw fit⸥\f + \fr 105:22 \ft Literally “in his desire \fq soul \ft ” \f*
and teach his elders wisdom.
Then Israel came \add to\add* Egypt,
and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Ham.
And he\f + \fr 105:24 \ft That is, God \f* made his people very fruitful.
He also made them\f + \fr 105:24 \ft Hebrew “him” \f* stronger than their\f + \fr 105:24 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* enemies.
He turned their heart to hate his people,
to deal deceitfully against his servants.
He sent his servant Moses,
together with Aaron whom he had chosen.
They set before them the words concerning his signs
and portents in the land of Ham.
He sent darkness and made \add it\add* dark,
and they did not rebel against his words.
He turned their waters into blood
and it killed their fish.
Their land swarmed with frogs,
\add even\add* in the chambers of their kings.
He spoke, and there came flies
\add and\add* gnats throughout all their territory.\f + \fr 105:31 \ft Hebrew “borders” \f*
He gave hail for their rains
\add and the\add* fire of lightning in their land.
And he struck their vines and fig trees,
and shattered the trees of their territory.
He spoke and there came locusts
and young locusts without number.
And they ate up all \add the\add* vegetation in their land,
and they ate up the fruit of their ground.
And he struck down all \add the\add* firstborn in their land,
\add the\add* first of all their virility.
Then he brought them out with silver and gold,
and there was none among his tribes who stumbled.
Egypt was glad when they departed,
because the fear of them\f + \fr 105:38 \ft That is, Israel \f* had fallen upon them.
He spread out a cloud for a covering,
and fire to give light at night.
They\f + \fr 105:40 \ft Hebrew “He” \f* asked, and he brought quail,
and satisfied them with \add the\add* bread of heaven.
He opened \add the\add* rock and waters flowed;
they coursed\f + \fr 105:41 \ft Or “surged” \f* through the dry places \add like\add* a river.
For he remembered his holy ⸤promise⸥;\f + \fr 105:42 \ft Literally “word” \f*
\add he remembered\add* Abraham his servant.
And \add so\add* he brought out his people with joy,
his chosen ones with rejoicing.
And he gave to them \add the\add* lands of \add the\add* nations,
and they inherited \add the\add* labor of \add the\add* peoples,
so that they might observe his statutes,
and keep his laws.
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 105:45 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
